aboutus.aboutusText: We are students from the Universidad del Valle de Guatemala and are excited to present Electronic Lock, our computer project. This system represents our dedication to providing an advanced solution in security and accessibility.

copyR.part1: The content of the web application 'Electronic Lock' is protected by copyright. 'Electronic Lock' is an innovative digital solution developed by students of Imaginary University. This notice establishes the terms under which you may use and access the content and services offered by 'Electronic Lock'. Copyright: All copyright and other intellectual property rights in relation to 'Electronic Lock' are owned by the developers and creators of the application, students of Imaginary University. Trademarks: The name 'Electronic Lock' and its associated logo are trademarks owned by the developers of the application. Use of Content: Viewing, downloading, and copying content from 'Electronic Lock' is permitted for personal, non-commercial use only. Any modification, redistribution, or reproduction of the content without explicit permission from the copyright owners is prohibited. Disclaimer of Liability: The developers of 'Electronic Lock' are not liable for any inappropriate or illegal use of the content or services offered on this platform. Privacy Policy: For more information on how your personal information is collected, used, and protected on 'Electronic Lock', please refer to our Privacy Policy. Contact: If you have questions regarding this copyright notice or wish to request additional usage permissions, please contact us at www.uvg.edu.gt. Last Updated: This copyright notice was last updated on June 17, 2024.

manual.manualdescription: This guide is essential to enhance your experience when using the application in real time. Here you will find detailed instructions on interacting with the buttons, as well as a brief description of their functions
manual.description1: This is a simple guide for using the application in the laboratory.
manual.description2: Press the lock button to open the electronic door, and remember to close the door once all students are inside.
manual.description3: Use the light buttons to turn on or off the lights divided into A (Front), B (Back), and C (LED strip).
manual.description4: You have completed the step-by-step guide.
manual.description5: Upon completion, you can review our documentation to get an idea of the project's construction.
manual.mf1D: Main component that contains the logic to handle authentication, lights, and other states.
manual.mf2D: Custom hook for managing user authentication.
manual.mf3D: Custom hook to obtain the current language and translations.
manual.mf4D: React hook for managing local state in functional components.
manual.mf10D: Method to access a collection in Firestore.
manual.mf11D: Method to add a document to a collection in Firestore.
manual.mf12D: Make a request to the URL http://IP-RASPBERRY-PI:5000/lab/chapa/1, update the loading state, and handle the logic for recording entries and exits in Firestore.
manual.mf13D: Make a request to a dynamic URL based on the current state of the lights (light and currentLightState). Update the loading state and change the state of the lights.
manual.mf14D: Format a date and time into a readable format.

privacyp.part1: This Electronics Laboratory, its tools, equipment and/or content, as well as attachments, are for CONFIDENTIAL use and may contain PRIVILEGED information intended solely for the recipient, user, and/or interested party. If you have received any information from this by mistake, please do not copy or distribute it, nor take any action related to it as it is strictly PROHIBITED. Instead, please notify the sender and/or responsible person immediately and delete it from your system promptly. The opinions expressed as a result of work in this laboratory are the sole responsibility of the author and are not necessarily shared or endorsed by the administration of this laboratory, which does not assume any obligations through this message nor is responsible for its content. Similarly, the developers of the mentioned laboratory exempt themselves from any liability for the improper use of this, the non-compliance with the instructions and rules described herein and/or the commission of any offense or crime, with the person using and/or entering this Laboratory, its devices, web applications, and other components bearing DIRECT RESPONSIBILITY. It is expressly stated that in accordance with current national and international legislation, this Electronics Laboratory reserves the legal actions that correspond against anyone who illegitimately accesses it (directly, indirectly, through third parties, internally and/or externally) and violates its security.
